title: Medicine Cabinet Makeover with Earth Mama Angel Baby Products

author.name: Sarah UmmYusuf
author.description: Sarah is a wife and mother with a passion for all things simple, natural, and homemade. Join her and thousands of others on their journey to a natural lifestyle!

content:
Disclosure: This post was written as part of a paid brand ambassadorship for Earth Mama Angel Baby. All opinions are my own and based on my own experience. This post also contains affiliate links because I truly love Earth Mama’s products and support their mission!

The first time I heard about Earth Mama Angel Baby products was when my son was about 6 months old. He developed a very bad diaper rash that wouldn’t go away no matter what product I tried. Finally, a friend of mine introduced me to Earth Mama’s Baby Bottom Balm, and after just one day of use I was sold.

Today I have the honor of joining Earth Mama Angel Baby as one of their brand ambassadors, and I couldn’t be more thrilled! For the next 30 days, I’ll be making over my medicine cabinet and swapping out as many of my products with Earth Mama Angel Baby products – and I’ll be updating you with the progress.

Earth Mama Angel Baby products are all certified organic and non-GMO, making them some of the safest products you can find on the market today. Remember: the organic label automatically means non-GMO, but the non-GMO label does NOT automatically mean organic. Because of the pesticides and herbicides used on conventionally grown crops, the organic label is ever so important when choosing products for mama and baby. What we use on our skin also gets absorbed into our body and goes to our bloodstream, which affects both mama and baby!

Home & Herbal First Aid with Earth Mama Angel Baby

The great thing about Earth Mama Angel Baby products is just how versatile they are – most of their products can be used and reused in so many different ways, so if you don’t think you’ll finish that tub of diaper cream, there are so many other ways you can use it for you and the whole family!  The products I received make up a Home and Herbal First Aid package, and include everything from soaps and diaper cream, to lip balms and herbal teas. This week I’ll be focusing on their castile soaps, diaper cream, and lip balms.

Castile Soaps

I’m a huge fan of castile soap and use it all over my home regularly, so I was very excited to try Earth Mama Angel Baby’s line of castile soaps. I received the Angel Baby Shampoo and Body Wash and the Calming Lavender Shampoo and Body Wash. All their soaps contain no artificial fragrances, foaming agents, sulfates, preservatives, parabens, or dyes. Of course, they’re all-natural and organic, and are perfect for baby bath time, hand washing and head-to-toe family clean.

I love anything with lavender, so I tried the Calming Lavender soap first on my baby girl. It smells so amazing and foams up beautifully! She was having a bit of a hard time with teething last week and developed a bad rash because of it, and this soap was oh so gentle on her tender skin. The lavender was also very calming – she rested on my chest for a good half hour after her bath, which is unheard of for her. 🙂

The Angel Baby soap is made with orange, calendula and vanilla, and although I didn’t think anything could beat the lavender scent, I was pleasantly surprised by this one. We’re using it at our bathroom sink, and it smells so refreshing! All of the Earth Mama Angel Baby soaps are certified organic by Oregon Tilth and rated “0” for toxins on the Skin Deep Database. Zero Toxins means they’re safe for everyone!

Also, check out these FIVE frugal uses for castile soap, including a household scrub, diaper wipes solution, and laundry detergent – so many amazing uses!

Angel Baby Bottom Balm

This is the product that started it all for me – the Angel Baby Bottom Balm. This is their #1 best selling salve; it’s clinically tested, safe for cloth diapers, and safely battles existing diaper rash and protects against flare ups. It’s also vegan (contains no beeswax) and certified organic by Oregon Tilth.

Plain and simple: this stuff just works! All it takes is a few applications, and my babies’ diaper rashes are gone by the end of the day. It sounds crazy, but it’s true. This diaper cream also smells amazing, unlike some of those other products on the market. It’s made of just the right combination of oils, butters, and herbs. The Angel Baby Bottom Balm is not just for baby bottoms either – it can be used to soothe rashes, burns, cuts and scrapes, chapped skin, cradle cap, thrush, and the list goes on!

Personally, I’ve been using it on the small eczema flare-ups I get on my fingertips, as well as an especially stubborn rough spot on one of my ankles. I love how smooth the balm is and how soft it makes my skin feel. If you’re going to try one product from Earth Mama Angel Baby, make it the Angel Baby Bottom Balm, trust me.

Earth Mama Lip Balms

I’m sorta kinda a lip balm fanatic – if you’ve been reading this blog for any length time, you may have already picked up on that. 😉 So getting to try all three of the Earth Mama Lip Balms was a real treat! All of their lip balms are 100% natural, certified organic, vegan, and contain no petrolatum, artificial flavoring, colors, or preservatives, and no toxins.

The lip balms come in three delicious flavors: Coconut Smoothie, Lavender Meringue, and Mint Herbal. Although I’m a lover of all things lavender, it was actually the coconut smoothie flavor that I fell in love with. It’s the perfect blend of silky smooth coconut and vanilla and smells oh so yummy! The lavender meringue has a nice, light lavender-vanilla scent, and the mint herbal is very, well…minty. 🙂 My son always has to ask for some lip balm whenever he sees me with a tube in my hand, so I love that these are completely natural and safe for kids as well.

These lip balms are so moisturizing; and they don’t just coat your lips, they actually absorb into the skin and soothe and heal them from the inside out. Good stuff!

Check out Earth Mama Angel Baby at their website and connect with them on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, and Google+ for the latest on sales and exclusive offers!

Earth Mama Angel Baby products can be purchased through their website, on Amazon, or locally at a store near you.

Have you tried any of Earth Mama Angel Baby’s products? What are your favorites, and how have you used them around your home and family?

title: 10 Tips for the Perfect Smoothie

author.name: Sarah UmmYusuf
author.description: Sarah is a wife and mother with a passion for all things simple, natural, and homemade. Join her and thousands of others on their journey to a natural lifestyle!

content:
Summer is here, and you know what that means – smoothie season! I try to start each day with a green smoothie most days of the year, but when Summer hits and the array of fresh fruit starts hitting the farmer’s markets, smoothie season is in full swing. Read on to find out some of the best tips for the perfect smoothie this summer!

Who doesn’t love a nice, creamy smoothie on a hot summer day? Making smoothies at home can be a little daunting at first – which recipes to use, how to get the right consistency, ice or no ice? – but once you’ve got the basics down, you’ll be blending them up like a pro in no time.

Tips For The Perfect Smoothie

  1. Choose Your Base: Always start with the base, and build up from there. You can use water, milk, fruit juice, coconut water, etc. depending on the flavors you’re using. If I’m not using water, I love to use Silk Almond Milk, especially since my son is sensitive to dairy.
  2. Order Matters: The best way to add the ingredients to your blender is liquid, greens, frozen fruit, add-ins, ice (if using), and then fresh fruit at the very end (after pre-blending the other ingredients). If your blender is having a bit of trouble, try blending in layers, ie: blend the liquid with the greens first, then add frozen fruit and blend, etc.
  3. Freeze Your Own Fruit: Summer is the perfect time to stock up on fresh fruit and freeze it for later. Lay your fruit out on a cookie sheet, flash freeze it, then transfer to a bag or container to store in the freezer. When your bananas are too brown or mushy, simply peel them and freeze to use later.
  4. Add Greens: Fruit smoothies are great, but the only thing better is a boost of nutritious vitamins and minerals found in greens like kale, spinach, romaine, etc. Adding greens to your smoothie won’t alter the taste much, but will definitely alter the nutrition content, and it’s a great way to get veggies into your picky eaters!
  5. Vitamin C Boost: The iron in dark leafy greens is best absorbed by the body when combined with a dose of vitamin C. So adding some lemon, orange, grapefruit, etc. either whole or in juice form is a great way to enhance iron absorption while also adding a fresh, tart flavor.
  6. Super Food Add-Ins: Smoothies are a great way to top on those super foods! I love adding chia seeds, hemp seeds, hemp protein powder, flax seeds, or even a big old spoonful of peanut or almond butter for a healthy protein boost.
  7. Probiotics: I love yogurt, and I especially love adding it to smoothies. It not only makes them thick and creamy, but it also packs a nice probiotic punch. I’ve even frozen leftover whey in ice cubes and used those in smoothies. You can also add your probiotic supplement right into the blender.
  8. Ice or No Ice?: I usually don’t add ice unless it’s the off chance that I’m all out of frozen fruit – it happens. The best thing is to blend everything up first, and then if you feel you need some ice, go ahead and add about 5 cubes or so. Too much ice can make your smoothie watery and compromise on flavor, so add a little at a time.
  9. Recipes: Start off with a couple of basic recipes to get you started so you can get the hang of how much of each ingredient to add. A good basic formula is 2 cups liquid + 2 cups greens + 3 cups fruit. Then just top off with any add-ins you’re using and blend away! You can also check out simplegreensmoothies.com for some great recipes.
  10. Upgrade Your Blender: Although you don’t need a high-speed blender, they do make the job much easier. I used to use a cheap $40 blender, which works fine if you use the blending advice in #2 above. I recently upgraded to a medium-speed one, which has made a huge difference in time and consistency. I’m saving up for the coveted Vitamix though – psst! Keep reading to find out how you can WIN a Vitamix blender and other goodies below!

WIN a Silk Summer Smoothie Kit!

Enjoy Silk Smoothies all summer long with a Silk Summer Smoothie Kit! One prize will be awarded each week and readers can enter once daily. Each winner will receive a kit that includes a Vitamix blender, a $350 Visa gift card, a Silk tumbler, eight Silk coupons (each good for one free 1.89 L Silk of any variety), and five recipe cards. The contest has started and ends July 27, 2014. The contest is only open to Canadian residents only – excluding Quebec. Enter HERE for your chance to win a Silk Summer Smoothie Kit!

What are your best smoothie tips and recipes?

title: Arborstead Natural Products Review & Giveaway

author.name: Sarah UmmYusuf
author.description: Sarah is a wife and mother with a passion for all things simple, natural, and homemade. Join her and thousands of others on their journey to a natural lifestyle!

content:
Welcome to the Made in the USA Giveaway Hop, hosted byHappy Mothering,Easy Green Mom and Brittleby’s Corner through the Green Moms Network! We’ve teamed up with a group of bloggers to bring you the chance to win prizes that are Made in the USA. After entering my giveaway, be sure to hop around and enter all of the other #USAMade giveaways listed on the linky at the bottom of this post!

 

At Nature’s Nurture, we’ve partnered with Arborstead Natural Products to tell you all about their lovely handmade, natural body care products.

Arborstead Natural Products Review

Arborstead Natural Products is a Pennsylvania, USA based company which specializes in natural body products like deodorant, lip balm, lip gloss and baby powder, and they also make a natural wood polish. Tim and Laura started their company after trying to find a natural aluminum- and paraben-free deodorant that actually worked. Not surprisingly, they couldn’t find anything that met their demands, so they set out to make their own. They now carry a variety of their all-natural, non-GMO, cruelty-free products in their Etsy shop.

I received a wonderfully generous review package from Arborstead, which included a full-size deodorant in their Ginger-Lime scent, a sample size of each of their other deodorant scents, and one of each scent of their lip balms and lip glosses. 

What I Love about Arborstead’s Products

Arborstead’s business practices are awesome, and their products really speak for themselves. 

  • They use all-natural, non-GMO, cruelty-free ingredients.
  • Their products are all handmade right in the USA.
  • They have a wide variety of very unique scents.
  • Their products actually work!

Their deodorant formula is also quite unique, made with kaolin clay and avocado oil, along with the usual coconut oil, beeswax, shea butter, and essential oils. I’ve tried my fair share of natural deodorants, and I’ve never used one with kaolin clay before, but I love it!

This stuff is the real deal, and totally stands up to the summer heat and sweat. I’ve been wearing it everyday for almost 2 weeks, and am very happy with how effective it is. I can smell the deodorant when I first put it on and for a few hours afterwards; by the end of the day I don’t smell the deodorant anymore, but I also don’t smell any sweat either, so I know it’s working.

The only thing that caught me off guard was how soft the deodorant is, especially if it’s warm in your house (like right now!). It’s not a deal breaker, as I’m actually used to storing my homemade deodorant in the fridge, but you just have to be a little careful when applying it and keep it in a cool spot. 

Arborstead Deodorant Scents

Did I mention their variety of unique scents? I’ve never seen so many all in one place, and they’re all lovely! Here’s a breakdown of how they smell:

  • Ginger & Lime – This is the one I choose in the full size, and I love it. It’s light, refreshing, and is one of the stronger scents.
  • Rosemary – Just like rosemary essential oil, this has an invigorating scent almost like eucalyptus.
  • Patchouli & Clove – Such a unique, earthy scent, and the spiciness of the clove is a nice companion.
  • Patchouli & Ylang Ylang – This was definitely my favorite. The sweet floral scent of the ylang yland mixed with the earth patchouli is an awesome combination!
  • Lavender – Always a classic, this one doesn’t disappoint.
  • Lemongrass & Eucalyptus – Eucalyptus is very strong and stimulating, and lemongrass is refreshing and uplifting; they compliment each other very well. 
  • Bergamot & Black Pepper – This is definitely the most unique scent – I mean seriously, black pepper? Yes, but when you couple it with the mellow, citrus-y scent of bergamot it actually smells pretty good.
  • Sage & Juniper – I found this to be the lightest of all the scents. It wasn’t very strong or overpowering, and had a light, sweet scent to it. 

Arborstead Lip Balms and Gloss

I also tried out Arborstead’s line of lip balms and lip gloss. I’m kind of addicted to lip balm, so I was really excited to receive such a generous collection of all of their scents! 🙂 The lip balms and glosses are made with avocado, coconut and castor oils, and beeswax, shea butter, and essential oils.

Along with the unscented (which actually has a nice, light scent), they also have some fun scents like lemongrass, peppermint, cinnamon, lemon & basil, grapefruit, and cinnamon & clove (my favorite!). 

The lip balms and gloss work very well and last for a long time before needing reapplication. They go on really smooth, and the smell is very light and not overpowering. These are some of the best lip balms I’ve ever tried. Thankfully I have a supply to last me for quite a while 🙂 , but when they do run out, I know I’ll definitely be ordering some more.

Arborstead is a company I can really support for their ethical business practices and great quality products. The owners are wonderful to work with, and their products are really top notch. Just check out the great reviews on their Etsy store for even more testimonials.

title: Citrus Mint Iced Tea

author.name: Sarah UmmYusuf
author.description: Sarah is a wife and mother with a passion for all things simple, natural, and homemade. Join her and thousands of others on their journey to a natural lifestyle!

content:
If you’ve got a lot of mint in your garden, like I do, you’ll love this recipe for citrus mint iced tea! It’s cool, refreshing, and tastes delicious. So very simple to make, and can be tweaked to really suit your taste. Now that Summer is officially here, the long, hot days have me making up a new batch of this iced tea almost everyday – it’s that good!

I have an abundance of mint growing in the garden bed that we inherited when we moved into our new house earlier this year. No really, it’s ridiculous…If you’re in Toronto and need some mint, just come on over! 🙂 But seriously, a word to the wise: don’t plant mint directly into the ground. Just don’t do it. Mint is crazy; it will literally take over your garden. You can’t kill it, and you can’t use it up fast enough. So if you want to grow mint, grow it in pots and containers, and save your sanity. 🙂

Anyways, I’ve been looking for any good reason to use up all this mint. Our background is Middle Eastern, and mint is one of the most popular herbs used in Middle Eastern food (hello, tabouleh!), but I wanted to find new ways to use mint. For as long as I can remember, our family has always had a jar of dried mint leaves in the cupboard to use in hot teas (mint is an excellent digestive aid!), so I thought why not try to infuse it into an iced tea? And let’s add some citrus fruit while we’re at it!

Citrus Mint Iced Tea
2014-06-23 22:19:35
Yields 6
A cool, refreshing mint iced tea with a hint of citrus flavor.
Write a review
Save Recipe
Print
Ingredients
  1. 6 cups water
  2. 6 bags of black or green tea (or 6 teaspoons of loose tea)
  3. 1/2 cup fresh mint leaves (about 3 sprigs), plus more for garnish
  4. 6-8 slices of citrus fruit (any combination of lemon, lime, orange), plus more for garnish
  5. 1/4-1/3 cup sugar or honey (or sweetener of choice)
  6. ice, for serving
Instructions
  1. Add water to kettle or pot and bring to a boil.
  2. Add tea, mint leaves, and citrus slices to a large teapot or measuring cup, and cover with boiling water.
  3. Let tea steep for 10 minutes (less if using green tea).
  4. Strain into a large pitcher, and add sugar or honey. Stir to dissolve.
  5. Serve over ice, and garnish with mint and citrus slices.
Notes
  1. If using loose tea, you may want to place the tea into a large tea ball or loosely tie it in some cheesecloth.
  2. After sweetening the tea, you can add the citrus slices right back into the pitcher - it's pretty and the slices continue to infuse into the tea as it cools.
  3. For an even more intense flavor boost, you can also add some fresh-squeezed citrus juice to the strained tea!
By Sarah @ Nature's Nurture
Nature's Nurture http://naturesnurtureblog.com/
Wordpress Recipe Plugin by Recipe Card

I’ve tried every combination of the three citrus fruits for this tea, and my favorite is about 3 slices of lemon + 5-6 slices of orange. After you’ve strained your tea, your could also try squeezing some citrus juice right into the pitcher for an even more intense flavor boost!

I’ve been adding mint to everything I can think of; salads, yogurt dip, hot tea, etc. I’m going to try making some pesto and maybe a chutney too. Any excess at the end of the season is going into my dehydrator (affiliate link) to be used for hot tea, or will be frozen to have on hand for the rest of the year. You can even use mint in tons of body care recipes as well! Check out more ideas for using fresh mint below:

More Ways to Use Mint:
Paleo Mint Avocado Ice Cream – Empowered Sustenance
Chocolate Mint Smoothie – Good Girl Gone Green
Mint Simple Syrup – Five Little Homesteaders
Mint Pineapple Smoothie – Green Thickies
Real Mint Tea – Amazing Graze Farm
Iced Peppermint Mocha – Natural Living Mamma

So, what are your favorite ways to use fresh mint? I need all the help I can get!

title: Ecocentric Mom to Be Box Review

author.name: Sarah UmmYusuf
author.description: Sarah is a wife and mother with a passion for all things simple, natural, and homemade. Join her and thousands of others on their journey to a natural lifestyle!

content:
This month I was lucky enough to review 2 different Ecocentric Mom boxes! In addition to the Mom and Baby box, I also got a “Mom to Be” box as well, since we’re expecting our third baby at the end of the summer. If you don’t know about Ecocentric Mom, it’s a fun and smart way to discover healthy, natural and organic products exclusively for moms, moms-to-be, and baby, delivered every-other-month right to your doorstep. 

So every couple months you get a box in the mail, like the one pictured above, with a bunch of new healthy, organic products to try. The boxes usually also include coupons or gift cards for the products – for $24 per box (including FREE shipping to the US) that’s a pretty awesome deal!

I’m signed up for the “baby” box (which also includes a few items for mom as well), but they also have boxes for “mom” and “mom-to-be”, so no matter what season of mommyhood you’re in, there’s something for you.

Ecocentric Mom to Be Box Review

Here’s what was in my Ecocentric Mom to Be box this month:

  1. Novena Organic Anti-Aging Mineral Sun Block ($26.99 value): An organic sun block with SPF 30. It’s vegan and sulfate, paraben, phthalate free. It’s also water resistant, which is great. Goes on smooth, doesn’t leave a white residue, no oily residue, and smells very nice.
  2. Licious Organics Raw Honey Chocolate Peanut Butter Cookie ($1.20 per cookie x 2): This raw, unbaked oatmeal cookie is sweetened with raw honey and is gluten, soy, and wheat free. I’m usually not a fan of raw cookies, but this one is actually very moist and tasty – even my 3 yr old like it! I think it’s the addition of the peanut butter that makes it so creamy, but I actually really like it. Also includes a 10% off discount code.
  3. ORGLAMIX All-Natural “Hot Mama” Eye Shadow ($9.00 value): Pure and natural loose color concentrate eyeshadow. Contains just three ingredients – no fillers, binders, or extenders like in most mineral makeup. It looks like a powder but goes on like a cream, so the color is very vibrant and long-lasting. No parabens, sulfates, fragrances, dyes, petrochemicals, phthalates, GMO’s, or Triclosan. Also includes a 20% off discount code.
  4. Ancestry Shampoo Bar by SoapMuffin Organic and Holistic Products ($5.oo per full size bar; travel size included): Shampoo bar made with 35 oz of raw coconut milk for a thick, rich, luscious lather. Contains fresh herbs and clay. I’ve always wanted to try a shampoo bar, and I really like it! It’s got a great lather, rinses clean, and leaves the hair feeling very soft and manageable. There’s no smell either, just clean. Also includes 5% off orders $40 or more on website.
  5. Sunshine Organic Herbals Healing Herbal Sitz Bath ($4 for 1 oz bag): An herbal blend of calendula, St. John’s Wort, Lavender, Yarrow, Uva Ursi, and Sea Salt. This is integral and absolutely necessary for post-partum care, so I’m really looking forward to trying this out after the birth. The mix smells so nice!  Also includes a 10% off discount code.
  6. All Natural Chocolate Caramel Swirl ($3.99 for 6 oz bag; 6 caramels included): Natural buttery caramels with a rich chocolate caramel swirl. These were awesome! I couldn’t get enough of them, and will definitely be ordering some more. 
  7. Monarch Farm Rose Complete Rejuvenating Face Cream ($5 for .25 oz travel size): An anti-aging cream made with truly natural, organic ingredients. Contains rose petal infused rosehip seed oil, rose absolute, and rose hydrosol for a moisturizing, regenerative cream – so you can only imagine just how amazing this cream smells! Also includes 15% off discount code.
  8. Wild Orange Natural Organic Solid Deodorant by Natures Natural ($1.95 for .35 oz travel size): A 100% natural and organic deodorant made with coconut oil, shea butter, carnuba wax, zinc oxide, arrowroot powder, arnica montana flower extract, and essential oils. Wonderful wild orange scent. Consistency looks a bit gritty at first, but once I put it on and rubbed it in, it was completely smooth and clear. Doesn’t contain any baking soda. Also includes Free Shipping offer.
  9. LrCrem Naturals “LeRevital Riche Body Souffle” ($3 for 1 oz travel size): A rich, creamy moisturizing cream made with neem, rosemary, jojoba, avocado, and essential oils. The cream feels great and goes on so smooth. No artificial additives, petroleum, or parabens. It has a light cherry blossom scent, but it was a bit too intense for me. The ingredients list phenoxyethanol (a preservative listed as a 4 on the EWG database), and “natural fragrance oils” (which I wasn’t too comfortable with). Other than that, it seems like a great cream. Also includes 10% off discount code.
  10. Antioxidant Rich Organic Nightly Repair Nectar by La Mav ($$49.95 for 1.1 oz full size; sample included): An anti-aging serum to protect skin from free radicals and the elements. Smooths fine lines and wrinkles, and improves uneven skin tone. Made with all-natural oils and extracts, and essential oils. It’s a long ingredient list, but everything checks out as natural and/or organic. Has a nice, light scent, and goes on easily without a very oily residue. Very impressive product. Also includes 10% off discount code.
  11. Knocked Up Nails Discount Offer (50% off online order): This was just a postcard with a special discount code on the back. I don’t really wear nail polish, but I can appreciate the fact that their polishes are all pregnancy-safe, cruelty free, vegan, gluten-free, and made in the USA. I really think they should’ve at least included a small sample bottle in the box, but again since I don’t really wear nail polish it’s not a big deal for me. 
  12. Miscellaneous Coupons

Body care items

This was a pretty big box with a great variety of products that are safe for pregnant mommas. Besides the chocolate caramels, I’d have to say the Ancestry Shampoo bar by SoapMuffin and the Monarch Farm Rose  Face Cream were my favorites. Oh, and I can’t wait to try out that sitz bath from Sunshine Organic Herbals!

Yummy food items

The approximate value of this month’s box is about $55, not including the coupons and discounts – a great value considering the Ecocentric Mom box only costs $24!

title: May Ecocentric Mom Box Review

author.name: Sarah UmmYusuf
author.description: Sarah is a wife and mother with a passion for all things simple, natural, and homemade. Join her and thousands of others on their journey to a natural lifestyle!

content:
My latest Ecocentric Mom box just arrived! If you don’t know about Ecocentric Mom, it’s a fun and smart way to discover healthy, natural and organic products exclusively for moms, moms-to-be, and baby, delivered every-other-month right to your doorstep. 

So every couple months you get a box in the mail, like the one pictured above, with a bunch of new healthy, organic products to try. The boxes usually also include coupons or gift cards for the products – for $24 per box (including FREE shipping to the US) that’s a pretty awesome deal!

I’m signed up for the “baby” box (which also includes a few items for mom as well), but they also have boxes for “mom” and “mom-to-be”, so no matter what season of mommyhood you’re in, there’s something for you.

Ecocentric Mom Box Review

Here’s what was in my “Mom & Baby” box this month:

  1. AllieLou Baby Organic Teething Ring ($8.50 value): This is a cute teething ring made of natural maple wood with no chemicals added and hand sealed with beeswax and olive oil to prevent splintering. It’s wrapped in a cotton/flannel fabric in a fun, colorful print. My daughter just started cutting her second tooth, so she’s been gnawing on this all week. Also includes a 10% off discount code.
  2. Licious Organics Raw Honey Chocolate Peanut Butter Cookie ($1.20 per cookie x 2): This raw, unbaked oatmeal cookie is sweetened with raw honey and is gluten, soy, and wheat free. I’m usually not a fan of raw cookies, but this one is actually very moist and tasty – even my 3 yr old like it! I think it’s the addition of the peanut butter that makes it so creamy, but I actually really like it. Also includes a 10% off discount code.
  3. Diaper Rash & Healing Salve by Airmidian Natural Remedies ($6.00 for 1 oz tin): This salve combines the healing powers of comfrey, calendula, and plantain with the moisturizing effects of vitamin E. Works for cuts and scrapes, and it’s safe for cloth diapers too. I really like this salve – I’ve used it to soothe my eczema as well as my daughter’s diaper rash. I love that it’s multipurpose and not just a diaper cream. Also includes a 20% off discount code.
  4. Words (My Book Block) ($9.95 value): A set of five miniature board books, each on a different subject: food, toys, garden, wild animals, and farm animals. For ages baby – 3 years. Not surprisingly, both my 10 month old and my 3 year old loved flipping through these books and looking at the large, colorful pictures. 
  5. Essential Night Cream & Sunscreen by Abundance Skin Care ($5 for 1/4 oz x 2): These two creams are for both mom and baby, which I love! The night cream is like an all-purpose cream, so I’ve used it for everything from my eczema hands, to my daughter’s dry feet after her bath, to my son’s scraped knee. I really love this stuff! It goes on smooth and any greasy feeling is gone within seconds. The sunscreen is SPF 30 and goes on pretty clear – you just have to rub it in really well and it won’t leave that dreaded white residue. Both creams use the same ingredients, except for the addition of zinc oxide in the sunscreen. Also includes a 20% off discount code.
  6. LrCrem Naturals “Sweet Pea Baby Shampoo” ($4.00 for 2 oz travel size): This natural shampoo for babies and children contains aloe, shea, and essential oils, and is pH balanced. No parabens, petroleum, or artificial additives. It has a lovely, mild rose/vanilla scent. Lathers up nicely and washes off clean. Also includes a 10% off discount code.
  7. Shapes (Little Hands) Board Book, by Katie Cox ($9.95 value): This is a colorful board book for babies and toddlers – again, both of my kids loved it. It’s all about different shapes and real-world examples of items with each shape, ie: Circle – Tomato. 
  8. Knocked Up Nails Discount Offer (50% off online order): This was just a postcard with a special discount code on the back. I don’t really wear nail polish, but I can appreciate the fact that their polishes are all pregnancy-safe, cruelty free, vegan, gluten-free, and made in the USA. I really think they should’ve at least included a small sample bottle in the box, but again since I don’t really wear nail polish it’s not a big deal for me. 
  9. Miscellaneous coupons

Baby Items

This month’s box was a bit smaller than usual, but it still contained lots of useful items. I was kind of disappointed seeing yet another diaper cream in the box, but this cream from Airmidian Natural Remedies was actually pretty awesome because it’s so much more than just a diaper cream! I especially loved the night cream and sunscreen from Abundance Skin Care as they are truly high quality products that I can see myself using regularly. And I love that each box so far has included books for the kids – we love books, and my 3-year old now looks forward to them in each box! 🙂

Mom Items

The approximate value of this month’s box is about $50, not including the coupons and discounts – a little less than previous boxes, but still a great value considering the Ecocentric Mom box only costs $24!
